## Overview

Markitecture can analyze your documentation to provide insights on readability, complexity, and content structure through beautiful metric badges.

<CodeGroup>
```bash Command Line
markitect --metrics.i docs/guide.md --metrics.s modern
```

```python Python
from markitecture.metrics import MetricsGenerator

# Generate metrics badge
metrics = MetricsGenerator().create_badge(
    input_file='docs/guide.md',
    style='modern'
)
```
</CodeGroup>

## Content Analysis

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Reading Metrics" icon="book-open">
    * **Reading Time**: Estimated time to read content
    * **Word Count**: Total words excluding code and URLs
    * **Average Sentence Length**: Words per sentence
    * **Content Density**: Distribution of content types
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Structure Analysis" icon="sitemap">
    * **Heading Count**: Number of section headers
    * **Code Blocks**: Count of code snippets
    * **Links**: Number of internal/external links
    * **Images**: Count of embedded images
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Complexity Score" icon="chart-line">
    Document complexity (0-100) based on:
    * Sentence length (30%)
    * Code density (30%)
    * Heading structure (20%)
    * Link density (10%)
    * Image ratio (10%)
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Style Customization

Customize badge appearance through color gradients and thresholds.

<CodeGroup>
```python Custom Colors
# Configure gradient colors for complexity levels
GRADIENT_COLORS = {
    "low": ["#7934C5", "#4158D0"],    # Purple -> Blue
    "medium": ["#00E5FF", "#4158D0"],  # Cyan -> Blue
    "high": ["#FFD700", "#FF00FF"]     # Gold -> Pink
}
```

```python Thresholds
# Adjust complexity thresholds
def get_gradient_colors(score: float) -> tuple[str, str]:
    if score < 40:          # Low complexity
        return GRADIENT_COLORS["low"]
    elif score < 70:        # Medium complexity
        return GRADIENT_COLORS["medium"]
    return GRADIENT_COLORS["high"]  # High complexity
```
</CodeGroup>

## Integration

Add metric badges to your documentation automatically:

<Steps>
  <Step title="Add to Pipeline">
    Include metrics generation in your documentation pipeline:
    ```python
    from markitecture.metrics import add_metrics_badge

    add_metrics_badge(
        input_file="README.md",
        style="modern",
        position="top"  # or "bottom"
    )
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Configure Style">
    Choose badge style and customize colors:
    ```python
    # Available styles
    BadgeStyle = Enum(
        "MODERN",    # Default modern with gradients
        "COMPACT",   # Minimalist single-line
        "DETAILED",  # Expanded with all metrics
        "MINIMAL",   # Clean, simple design
        "RETRO",     # Classic badge style
        "SHIELDS"    # shields.io style
    )
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step title="Generate Badge">
    Run metrics generation:
    ```bash
    markitect --metrics.i input.md --metrics.o badge.svg
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>

## API Reference

<ResponseField name="analyze_document" type="function">
  ```python
  def analyze_document(content: str) -> ReadabilityMetrics:
      """Analyze document and generate readability metrics."""
  ```
  Returns metrics object with:
  * `word_count`: Total word count
  * `sentence_count`: Number of sentences
  * `avg_words_per_sentence`: Average words per sentence
  * `reading_time_mins`: Estimated reading time
  * `complexity_score`: Document complexity (0-100)
  * `heading_count`: Number of headings
  * `code_block_count`: Number of code blocks
  * `link_count`: Number of links
  * `image_count`: Number of images
</ResponseField>

<ResponseField name="generate_svg" type="function">
  ```python
  def generate_svg(
      metrics: ReadabilityMetrics,
      style: BadgeStyle = BadgeStyle.MODERN
  ) -> str:
      """Generate SVG badge with specified style."""
  ```
</ResponseField>

## Best Practices

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card title="Badge Placement" icon="arrow-up-right-from-square">
    Position badges at the top of documentation for visibility:
    ```markdown
    ![Metrics](badge.svg)
    # Document Title
    Content...
    ```
  </Card>

  <Card title="Style Selection" icon="paintbrush">
    Choose badge style based on:
    - Modern/Detailed: Main documentation
    - Compact/Minimal: READMEs
    - Shields: Technical docs
  </Card>

  <Card title="Color Schemes" icon="palette">
    Match badge colors to your:
    - Documentation theme
    - Brand colors
    - Code highlighting
  </Card>

  <Card title="Updates" icon="rotate">
    Regenerate badges when:
    - Content changes significantly
    - Structure is modified
    - New sections added
  </Card>
</CardGroup>
